Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup with handle root; interior glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of forepart of feline - panther or lion with head (now missing) turned back (added red on neck and chest; stripe in added white on underbelly); black around handle root and below frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "20" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 409, no. B621) (labelled 1912.37.15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0442) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
